main event: The report describes the sighting of a round, silver object approximately 15-20 feet in diameter that was observed for 10-15 seconds in Springfield, Missouri on June 22, 1955.
interesting points: The object was trailing white smoke and emitting a steady, bright light.
The object changed direction, initially traveling south and then turning about 15-20 degrees to the west before disappearing behind a group of trees.
The report mentions that the object was possibly an aircraft, but the steady bright light it emitted was not typical of an aircraft.
The area was searched by the Missouri State Patrol, but no further evidence was found.
The report indicates that the object may have been a balloon, but the description of its movement and lack of sound suggest it was not a typical balloon.
sighted object: round, silver object approximately 15-20 feet in diameter
